website_summaries.verdict: Great optics at 200 to 300 yards, making this an excellent target spotting scope with just a few flaws, such as chromatic distortion at long distances.
pros: Built sturdy and resistant to drops and jarring
Excellent image quality at the lower end of the zoom, and very good optics farther out
Cleanly spots targets and shot groups at 300 yards
cons: Field of view narrows quite a bit past 60x – not surprising at its midrange price point
Some color halos around faraway objects
Included tripod is too flimsy for the scope to stay stable

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for target shooting, primarily 5.56 at distances of 100 and 300 yards. At 100 yards, the target is very clear and with enough magnification to easily see 556 holes in white paper targets. At 300 yards, with full magnification, the focus is a little fuzzy and I could not see 556 holes in white paper targets but when I used splattter targets with yellow on a black background, I was able to make out my hits. Not crystal clear but enough to make the necessary adjustments. Can't see this scope working for shooting much beyond 300 yards but 300 or less, I think it works well enough for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Alexander IV

customer_reviews.title: cannot see clear in 200 yards target
customer_reviews.text: I got chance to range today for target shooting in 200 yards. But I couldn't see my bullet holes on target and it's blur, couldn't get focused.
customer_reviews.author: chengfu

customer_reviews.title: Flawed T-mount adapter
customer_reviews.text: Great scope, but when digiscoping (using Celestron's own T-mount for Nikon) the T-mount threads always get stuck to the end glass of the eyepiece, where the T-adapter threads are. Since the threads are the same direction as that part of the eyepiece, this means every time I go to unscrew the T-mount adapter it takes the last element of the eyepiece with it, and often there two get stuck together. Last time this happened I couldn't get them unstuck until I bought a lens spanner wrench to get enough torque on the eyepiece element. I'm not sure why the eyepiece itself isn't purged and sealed instead of having this easily unscrewed piece at the end able to come off.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Work, but glue the eyecup, poor design, expensive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to view an eagle nest behind my shop. Worked OK but blue image edges because of no ED glass. You dont get a $1000 scope for $200, you get a $200 scope. The rubber eye cup is too soft and falls off very easy. I decided to buy a spare and the Celestron “parts” website page is about worthless. After several emails I finally got a $25 price for this little part so instead Ill get super glue. Glue the rubber eye cup before you loose it. The eagles moved on, but watching them feed their eaglet was great. If the eyecup falls off again I’ll buy a better scope.
customer_reviews.author: J. Poux

customer_reviews.title: Useless past 20X zoom with very bad purple fringing.
customer_reviews.text: I like the brand Celestron because for years it was for me while I was growing up the brand that sold high quality astronomy optics. So I decided to buy this Ultima80 hoping it would serve me both birding and star/moon viewing. I am completely disappointed by how the set up works only at 20X magnification. Anything above that the scope is unable to provide a clear picture despite efforts to keep focussing. The worst part of the lens is that past 20x all the way to 60x, there is very bad purple fringing which makes it impossible to be certain what colours the birds are precisely. I would not recommend this scope.
customer_reviews.author: H. TAN

customer_reviews.title: I bought the 65 after returning the 80.. both over promise in reviews.
customer_reviews.text: Tricked by review hype. The 80.. The example I received had poor quality control. The picture in the eye piece was off center, and suffered from a vertical blur. The item was useless and returned. The one I got had no where near the quality of the images in other reviews. The 65.. Just blurry past 27x. There are reviews here that over promise, so if you need to actually zoom in to spot wildlife, these are likely going to be leaving you lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Brown

customer_reviews.title: #1 Best Scope for under $200
customer_reviews.text: I have never used a scope before. I am military and needed a scope that came highly recommended but wasn't going to break my wallet (I have four kids) boy! Whoever had anything bad to say about this product is an enemy to budget savers! I am from Fort Carson Military Base that is seated on the side of a mountain. What appeared invisible from the backyard, became crystal clear with the scope! At over 700 meters I could see a campsite with a child in a white shirt riding a bicycle. It was amazing! I will have no issues using this as a spotting scope for 300-600 meters!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: A decent Scope for the Price
customer_reviews.text: It is a good scope to bring nature a bit closer, at 20x the picture quality is pretty decent, once you go to 60x things are not quite as sharp but reasonable for the price paid. The tripod that came with looks really cool and is easy to work, HOWEVER, i find this tripod lacking in stability which means things are a bit bouncy when using it inside (have not taken it outside yet). So i decided to get my 35 yr old Velbon tripod which has the basic controls on it but is much much more sturdy, as a result the viewing pleasure has increased as well.
customer_reviews.author: The Flying Dutchman

customer_reviews.title: Best value in a spotting scope
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the shooting club to use as a spotting scope. This is a quality scope with great optics and the size is perfect for continuous use. Two club members have bought these scopes for their personal use after looking through this scope. It is crystal clear to say the least. Highly recommended and hundreds less than a Leupold scope or any other quality scope. There have been no short cuts taken with this scope. A great find.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bogart

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: A great spotting scope. I use it for both terrestrial and astronomy observation. You can easily see the 4 Gallilean moons of Jupiter and the rings of Saturn. The carrying case is well made. Be sure to get a quality tripod. The only down side to this scope is the front lens cap. It is very flimsy. It has two detents that are supposed to anchor on the inner diameter of the front lens, but it doesn't work very well. All in all a great purchase and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bill W

customer_reviews.title: Nice optics
customer_reviews.text: I'm picky when it comes to optics quality and this scope made me smile when I took it out for a spotting test. You can count the needles on a pine tree at 50 yards with no bluing distortion. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Alphadog

customer_reviews.title: Celestron Ultima spotting scope and phone adapter
customer_reviews.text: Scope is pretty large and heavy so you will need a tripod. It looks like a good quality scope and should last a lifetime. This was a requested Christmas gift so I don't know much about it. Came with the phone adapter too!
customer_reviews.author: Dale A Terry

customer_reviews.title: Great scope, not small
customer_reviews.text: Got this to set up in our home to be able to look out at nature's beauty whenever it beckons. It is great for that purpose but be sure to have the room for it. The scope is good size itself. And mounted on an appropriately stable tripod, it will take some room. That issue aside, it is a great scope for looking at the world!
customer_reviews.author: KJ Northrup

customer_reviews.title: Don't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: It just didn't have the clarity I needed for 200 yards and beyond. I bought a Kronos for a little more and is much better clarity.
customer_reviews.author: jeff mckeel

customer_reviews.title: Like any high magnification lens
customer_reviews.text: The scope was packed well and arrived very quickly. I was surprised at the clarity of the lens. I can see the numbers on the mail box 500-600 feet away very clearly.(at maximum magnification.) I can even see the neighbors gutter nail heads at this distance. If you are using this for target spotting, you should not have any difficulty seeing .22 caliber holes 200 yards away. Like any high magnification lens, you need a good tripod. I would not hesitate to buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its finding the field of view that's the trick.
customer_reviews.text: Great product so far. I'm novice in optics and wanted the vortex ,but this price is unbeatable for a high quality product. Most reviews are correct. If you wear glasses its next to impossible to use this scope. You need good vision already and have to press your eye almost against the lens to see. The true test will be during hunting season.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Rella

customer_reviews.title: Clarity all the way.
customer_reviews.text: Purchases another spotting scope from another big name manufacturer. I was disappointed in the clarity and overall quality. Actually the aluminum case it came in was superior to the quality of the scope. A buddy told me to check out a Celestron which I did.. That was very good advise. Solid as a rock and clarity at over 100 yards. When shooting a .22 LR of a 5.56 clarity is a must with the small round hole. Also I have wasted less ammo sighting in other scopes I have bu using less ammo. If you are looking for good without spending the big dollars try this Celestron.
customer_reviews.author: (S)Samantha Moceri

customer_reviews.title: It's OK - too much sun flare - barrel does not rotate in mount to facilitate bench viewing
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a sporting scope for 100 yard rifle shooting. I have been a little disappointed. The mount does not allow the barrel to rotate which limits how you set it up for viewing. Get a lot of sun flare on sunny days.which challenges good viewing. Do wish there was some kind of sun shade option. It's OK but not great.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a decently build scope. However, the maximum useful magnification, however, is about 35X, at most - 40X. At higher magnifications, both eye relief and exit pupil become way too small for comfortable viewing.
customer_reviews.author: Ritter

customer_reviews.title: super scope
customer_reviews.text: I had hoped to purchase this scope for a trip to Yellowstone but just couldn't justify the cost. When it came on sale I gave in..... and SO glad I did! Took it on vacation to the Sierras first thing. We stay at 9600 feet plus elevation.... we could watch the pica and squirrels at the top of the ridge and identify flowers blooming on the rock face. Amazing... and very easy to use. Color quality remained high. A little trouble finding target but that just takes practice. We also watched a mother bear and three cubs from about 800 feet away, we could see their whiskers!
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: A fine scope
customer_reviews.text: Truly, for the money. No, it's not Swarovski, but we knew that. Works great through 70% of its zoom capability and is really fine at the lower end - you can compare it to anything in that range. More to the pint, the quality lacking can be bolstered with a higher quality eyepiece, which Celestron offers a range of. Very nice balance, has a solid, quality feel and works. We employ this from our home which looks over a bay that holds some of the best birding in Washington State; it does not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: UrbanMoniqueTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Not what you'd hope for, but exactly what you should expect.
customer_reviews.text: If you need clear crisp image this is not the spotting scope for you. Overall, I wish I had purchased a decent pair of binoculars to verify groupings instead. Less magnification with better overall image quality would be preferable. Pro, cheap 20x magnification. Con, not terribly clear optical quality. A bit of rainbow-ish shine on everything. Con, dark for an 80mm optic. I wouldn't have guessed. Con, the included tripod is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: S.Prior

customer_reviews.title: Good Spotting Scope for intermediate distance shooters even small caliber
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scope to spot my .308 bolt rifle and my AR15 5.56 at 300 yards. It works fine I put it on an inexpensive camera tripod and sit it on the ground next to the bench. To be reasonable I am using dirty bird type splat targets but it also works with steel disks painted white. I haven't tried it on plain paper. I'm not sure that it would be good beyond 300yards but where I live there aren't any ranges where you can shoot farther. I think the scope is a great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Cottone

customer_reviews.title: Great scope, good eye relief, fixed base.
customer_reviews.text: It is a great scope for the money with good eye relief, I would have given it 5 stars if the mount was adjustable so you could rotate it to change the viewing angle. That being said it is great as a spotting scope for target shooting and works better than my older bushnell scope. For less than $30 you can buy a quick release ball joint adapter to mount it to a spotting scope, but be wary of the cheaper ones, this scope is over 4lbs and needs a heavy duty adapter like this  Overall, I'm very happy with it, and I believe it is a great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Big Shep

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I've a binocular which currently sells for $501.00 It's magnification is 8x. To supplement the binocs for birdwatching, I bought the Celestron scope. Very glad I did, because now I have (at the very least) more than twice the magnification at about a fifth of the cost of the binocs. The scope arrived today (I tried some else's recently) and I've experienced viewing pleasure. No birds around, but I'll probably be looking at the moon tonight. Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mikel

customer_reviews.title: Great first spotting scope
customer_reviews.text: Great spotting scope. Comes with case and caps. My only recommendation is don’t skimp on the tripod. When this thing is zoomed all the way in just the slightest shake can move the PoA. The only reason I give it a 4/5 is because something inside is rattling around. Doesn’t effect the preformance though. Also here is a pic the moon with the scope.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Reddish

customer_reviews.title: Very good lens for the money
customer_reviews.text: Read lots of reviews before buying and have to agree for the money it's pretty hard to beat this scope. For a CASUAL user, birds, astronomy, range targets out to 1-200 yards, etc., this will serve you well. Professional users or viewing for long duration, you will quickly soon outgrow this one.
customer_reviews.author: Dave E

customer_reviews.title: ... other reports that I have read I am so happy that at 200 yards I can see the
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to other reports that I have read I am so happy that at 200 yards I can see the .223 holes created by my hunting rifle. For the money you can't go wrong with this spotting scope!
customer_reviews.author: Larry H

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointing
customer_reviews.text: It really doesn't provide any better picture than my 34x scope and I understood this was a 60x magnification.
customer_reviews.author: M. Timmons

customer_reviews.title: Perfert for a day at the range
customer_reviews.text: Extremely hard to beat for the money. I have used several different brands of spotting scopes that are both more and less expensive. I can say for a day at the range it is perfect. At 300 yards the 5.56 and 30cal rounds holes are perfectly clear. I will most likely never use it beyond 300 yards so I cannot speak to distances beyond that. Also, since this is an 80mm scope is does require a tripod that will support a larger scope. Couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: David Davis

customer_reviews.title: I really like this scope
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent spotting scope for the price. I own the 80mm and suggest that you don't spend the extra hundred for the 100mm. This scope has great clarity for a non HD scope and the only cons are it has only moderately good eye relief, and is not as clear from 40-60x as other scopes of this quality. Also its a bit heavy so a good tripod is an essential. I use this scope for hunting and was able to see a 6x7 bull elk at about 1500 yards. This is a great all round scope.
customer_reviews.author: Hoosier in CO

customer_reviews.title: Celestron 52250 80mm Spotting Scope
customer_reviews.text: This is not exactly the highest quality scope, but the price of this scope does reflect what you can expect. So, I do not understand the other people's complains. You can see fine for about 800 yards. If you need to see beyond that distance, the image contrast drops a lot such images become hazy. I am using this scope for target shooting with my long range rifle, Sig SSG 3000. I am very happy with my scope and I recommend to anyone who wants a quality scope for $160 investment.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: The view is great and the hole are visible with out having to ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this spotting scope so I could view .22 cal holes at a 100 yard range I have set up. The view is great and the hole are visible with out having to max out the magnification. A good price and packaged well with no damage during shipment. I just need to purchase a good tripod to mount it on and I'll be set.
customer_reviews.author: retired9352

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: For the cost, this is a great scope. images at widest setting are clear and crisp. The image quality at the maximum zoom setting is less than stellar, but then again acceptable unless you're trying to read over someone's should from across the bay. I'd still recommend this scope to someone who's looking to a great alternative to high-end scopes with large price tags.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very clear for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I have the 80mm version. I bought this for shooting and was surprised at the clarity. Can easily see 223 and 7mm holes at 200 yards. I did not get a chance to shoot further but am pretty sure you could go 300 yards. I found that it was probably better at about 40-50 power rather than 60.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works fine.
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for the 60 mm which was taken from my truck. It is excellent. I am not a serious look at the stars kind of guy but I can see all the planets with it. Jupiter is awesome with its 4 moons visible through this scope.
customer_reviews.author: Hombresolo

customer_reviews.title: Great scope for the money
customer_reviews.text: Worked great nice clear picture. Works best with a sturdy stand. Price was good for a quality scope. Will need a better quality travel case to better protect. Have not needed the warranty but on writing it looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy.  Very good sight picture.
customer_reviews.text: Terrific scope. I'll be using it at the 100 yard range to sight in my AR and to use to check accuracy of my 100 yard shooting. Great product for the money. It's a large scope, so don't think you'll just toss it in your range bag and head out. Case is soft so i will build my own wooden case to further protect the scope.
customer_reviews.author: Merrill  Clark

customer_reviews.title: It takes some getting used to.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Have had a Busnell Spacemaster for years and thought I would give this one a try. It is ok but falls short, viewing angle is very hard to get used to and eye distance is critical. Sadly, this will be my beater scope and the old Spacemaster will stll be my primary scope.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice spotting scope
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a Celestron astronomy telescope years ago and was pleased with the product. This spotting scope is about the same quality and has good magnification. At the highest setting the image is a little blurred but for the price I can live with it. A larger objective lens would be better but the price would be considerably more. I gave it 4 stars because nothing is perfect. It's easy to manage and focus. I really do like it and of course you mount it on a good tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Bluegoose

customer_reviews.title: It seems well built and easy to use other than the zoom/focus issue
customer_reviews.text: The problem is that as you change the zoom it goes out of focus. You have to refocus while zooming. Also it seems that the label with the zoom magnification seems to have fallen off so now we can't find what zoom level we are at. It seems well built and easy to use other than the zoom/focus issue. Nice sharp images. Nice carrying bag is awkward to use the scope inside the bag with the ends open for a rainy day as the focus is not accessible.
customer_reviews.author: scubado

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have used it at the gun range on more than one occasion now. It has performed exceptionally well. I have never had to take it off the lowest power to see where the hits have been. I have not used it on the 600 yard range, yet, but from the way it performed on the 200 yard range, it should work great. If you don't have a tripod, you will need to get one, because a tripod does not come with this scope.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B

customer_reviews.title: Great budget spotting scope!
customer_reviews.text: Having used everything from Harbor Freight to Swarovski Optik spotting scopes, I found this to be a great value. For the price, I don't think you can beat this spotting scope. Sure, it doesn't compare to the Swarovski, but you don't compare a Mustang with a Ferrari. I'd recommend this to anyone who needs a spotting scope, and doesn't have a big budget.
customer_reviews.author: M. D.

customer_reviews.title: Quality spotting scope at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice spotting scope. Constructed of quality materials. Nice smooth focusing. Good light gathering capacity, with good definition at highest power setting. Very good for the money.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good Scope, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Value! There is a blue tinge at the higher magnification, but you can get rid of that by buying the $900 scope instead. Image clarity is great. Ours is used on a monopod at minimum mag and it's steady enough, but we would put it on a tripod for higher mag. I might have bought the straight version vs the angled viewing model if I would have thought about it more.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Lindo (or her hubby)

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for use at the range. I'm glad I spent the extra $$ to buy this one. Some of the cheaper scopes come with a hard case, stand, etc. This ships only with a soft case but the quality is excellent. I can read street signs at 400+ yrds. I can easily see shots at 300+ yards. Also effective at a close range. This was also fun to use to look at the moon, etc. I might purchase a stand so I can use my digital SLR with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big
customer_reviews.text: On the 20x it’s beautiful but as you zoom in it gets pretty dark.
customer_reviews.author: SteveRup

customer_reviews.title: I use it for target shooting.
customer_reviews.text: It works well for me for target shooting at 100 & 200 yards although with the saftey glasses on, i can only use it at the lowest setting of 20x. Still it is quite enough to see .22 caliber holes at 200 yards. I typically lay it across two sandbags which almost allows me to check my target without very little movement of my head.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: The scope gives a bright, clear, sharp image at 20X, and the image has only very slight degradation at the edges of the field of view. At 60X the image is something just short of "sharp," but it's good, and the edge-to-edge quality is quite acceptable. The scope is solid and tight, and the focusing knob (perhaps awkwardly placed, but that's a matter of taste) works smoothly. The soft case is functional, and the plastic container for storage of the eyepiece is ingenious and provides very good protection. All in all, a thoroughly satisfying instrument for the money, and I would recommend the scope to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: PHILIP A CLARK

customer_reviews.title: Great scope.
customer_reviews.text: Great scope. A bit heavy but very clear and sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: John Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great spotting scope experience
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a spotting scope at the rifle range and am very happy. I use it for 22 (magnum) at 100 yds and for 7.56mm at 200 yds. The bullet holes are VERY easy to see. The focus works very smooth and evenly. At max magnification there is some optical distortion but that has no effect on what I am doing. It still looks focused.
customer_reviews.author: BobP

customer_reviews.title: Looked seriously at $800 spotting scopes but this has great resolution at every magnification and the objective gathers a ...
customer_reviews.text: Looked seriously at $800 spotting scopes but this has great resolution at every magnification and the objective gathers a lot of light for a clean image. Can't imagine anything else with as much bang for the bucks. If money is no object, spend more. Otherwise buy this. Spend part of the difference on a good tripod and a decent pan and tilt head.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A. Rumbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use with my camera tripod. I bought an adaptor to use my iPhone with the scope to take pictures of birds at my birdfeeders and elsewhere in the woods and lake areas near my house.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Celestron 80mm
customer_reviews.text: The price point is really excellent for the quality of this unit. Great clarity at max power during bright daylight. Still quite good and acceptable for general scenic use at dusk. The moon has sufficient light for this to be an impressive viewer. I recommend this for general and rifle range use.
customer_reviews.author: Pigiron

customer_reviews.title: I was able to see mosquito size items out there 200 yard pretty clear. I took a picture with my iphone ...
customer_reviews.text: After a short while researches I finally decided to buy this product. This is my first spotting scope. I took it to range next day. I was able to see mosquito size items out there 200 yard pretty clear. I took a picture with my iphone 6. I will upload the picture as well. This is 458 Yard range on a sunny day. So, let the picture do the talking. Overall I really satisfy with this scope.
customer_reviews.author: Slc

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, works as expected. It's not a top of the line scope, but what do expect for the price. I can see the bullet holes at 100yrds on a cloudy day. I'll have to report back when i try it on a 200yrd range, the eye relief could be better, i have to position myself just right in order to see the image.
customer_reviews.author: Wingfoot 3A

customer_reviews.title: Needs a tripod
customer_reviews.text: Used mostly for hunting, the glass quality is alright but the higher the zoom the worse it gets you get what u pay for with this.
customer_reviews.author: Chaodyn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! For the price.
customer_reviews.text: This scope is absolutely well worth the money. Views are sharp and clear at 20X zoom with plenty of light and color. The image does significantly degrade as the zoom is increased. Significant chromatic aberration and blurriness shows the inferiority of the optic components used. However, this scope has brought a ton of enjoyment in looking at the moon, mountains and the few animals around in the winter. For the price, this can't be beat and I won't feel bad if we upgrade in the future. If you are looking for very high quality images, you will have to spend more. Mounts well to any standard tripod. Scope and eyepiece have excellent carry bags and covers.
customer_reviews.author: Shoes508

customer_reviews.title: Short to mid-range spotting scope
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a spotting scope for sighting in my rifles at 100 yards, with the option to later go up to 200-300 yards. I've not used it past the 100-yard range so far, but I have experimented a bit at 200 and it appears to be usable to sight targets at that distance.
customer_reviews.author: kc1tom

customer_reviews.title: How to get away
customer_reviews.text: This is a great scope! The optics allow good focus and the available adapter T-ring (Celestron 93419) allows me to mount my Canon 60D securely to the scope for great wildlife photography and detail shots at a distance far enough away to avoid disturbing he subject(s). Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: David Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great lens and easy to focus super clear
customer_reviews.text: Very clear and good quality. I am surprised at the quality for the price. It is wonderful on the tripod however a little heavy if you take it off the tripod and try and hold it awkward.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Celestron 52250 80mm Ultima Zoom Spotting Scope
customer_reviews.text: A great spotting scope at a fantastic price. We used the scope on a winter trip to Yellowstone. It was easy to scan ridgelines with 20X power and then zoom in for crystal clear views, particularly of wolves.
customer_reviews.author: HodgeL

customer_reviews.title: eye cup is a little flimsy
customer_reviews.text: great scope for the price and glad with my choice . just wish there was better eye relief.its a little hard to see with my eyeglasses on . also my eye cup falls off some times . other than that it's a great scope for the price and definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The clarity of the lens is very good in low light condition
customer_reviews.text: Finding my shot at a 100 yards on paper target is an ease with this scope. The clarity of the lens is very good in low light condition. I really enjoy this spotting scope, and the price is reasonable for the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Yeti Houston

customer_reviews.title: Day/Night flexibility and excellent Optics. I would buy this with a smaller ...
customer_reviews.text: Day/Night flexibility and excellent Optics. I would buy this with a smaller aperture to any Maksutov claiming terrestrial viewing. The glass is great quality and the zoom is decent with regards to eye relief. Quick to set up and well weighted for balance
customer_reviews.author: This is a Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Use it for spotting at the archery range, I ...
customer_reviews.text: Use it for spotting at the archery range, I can tell which arrows are mine at that range. Used it at the rifle range too, was able to see bullet holes in the target at 100 yards. Have not yet had the opportunity for longer distances
customer_reviews.author: charlie w

customer_reviews.title: Super clear picture
customer_reviews.text: Super clear picture. I bought it for the gun range but it is great for looking at the moon as well.
customer_reviews.author: Fixer550

customer_reviews.title: Find a different scope
customer_reviews.text: Not happy at all, at 100 yards you can barely make out hits on a target. Distorted blurry view.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Great spotting scope for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Easily see targets and .22 holes at 100yds. Image gets a bit darker when zooming in but not enough to be a problem. Hope to try it out soon at 300 yds. Highly recommend for use at the range.
customer_reviews.author: King Of Scotland

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great scope. I use it at upto 200yards and it's clear
customer_reviews.author: roman

customer_reviews.title: Not a great purchase from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: This is a very descent product but I struggle to focus on wild life that is moving. It's much easier to focus on the moon, but unfortunately it doesn't have enough magnification to see all the lunar features. Not a great purchase from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: RJV

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money!
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality scope. Great for checking 5.56 target holes at 100 yards. Since I own a Silk tripod for cameras, I put this scope on that tripod and could not be more pleased. Awesome also for viewing critters, the moon, etc. A very nice, well built product.
customer_reviews.author: foxbat

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: When observing the moon I notice a little chromatic aberration in the lower left quadrant of mine. Too bad their coating QC isn't better. It works but is a bit unwieldy as a spotting scope. Otherwise it's a good scope for the money I paid. Maybe we'll get lucky and have a Great Comet to use it on come December.
customer_reviews.author: Briney Eye

customer_reviews.title: Why buy anything else?
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, unless you're an ultra-serious photographer, birder, elk hunter in the High Rockies, or some other "pro" -- why on Earth buy a different spotting scope. This one is, in a word, phenomenal. Great optics, great build quality, great case. It does what it says. We can see targets at 200 yards no problem. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Steele

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for sighting in at 100 yards and scope adjustments.  VERY pleased
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a gift. For the hundred range targets, this provides stunning clarity. Easy to use, good size, and seems to be solidly made. He is VERY happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Kim D.

customer_reviews.title: Very good as a terrestrial scope
customer_reviews.text: I live in a big city but I have a very good sight of the shoreline and I use this scope to watch the movement of ships at the sea. It is very good and I can't notice any variations on color or any distortions on this particular use. I haven't had the opportunity to put it to the test in a good night time conditions as the sky here is too bright for any serious attempt to see stars.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Paulo

customer_reviews.title: Great spotting scope
customer_reviews.text: We needed a spotting scope for our daughters outdoor archery shooting, and this scope does everything it needs to do and does it well. She got used to it very quickly and has no problem dialing in and focusing on those arrows at 60 yards. This will work well all the way to 90 meters no problem in my opinion but she will shoot at most 70 meters.
customer_reviews.author: I am ...

customer_reviews.title: Great scope. It looks and feels well made
customer_reviews.text: Great scope. It looks and feels well made. I needed something to at least reach out to 100 yard targets and this works great. Been to the range with it a couple times and I am able to see clearly my bullet holes from 100 yards clearly. Both days I was out at the range it was a cloudy not much sun day. I would recommend this mid to low range scope.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money at 40X
customer_reviews.text: This scope is a good compromise between the 60mm and the 800-100mm $1,200+ scopes. Fuzzy at full zoom which is typical of all these cheaper scopes. Use to watch birds from my house vantage point over a pond & etc..
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice glass for the $
customer_reviews.text: Great glass for the money. I use primarily at the range, as well as people watching when in the backcountry. No complaints
customer_reviews.author: ScottL

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great Quality for the price. Used for shooting at a rifle range. I would recommend to other buyers.
customer_reviews.author: John Trahan

customer_reviews.title: This scope keeps you in the shooter seat.
customer_reviews.text: Makes going to the range much better, can adjust my shot much quicker, would recommend to anyone who enjoys target shooting, also great to take a peek at the moon from time to time
customer_reviews.author: Gary Reed

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased that I purchased this scope. Clear optics, Better than I expected for the price. I have been using at the rifle range and at 100 yards the targets are very clear and I am able to see my shots.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great spotting scope.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for the range. I shoot at 100 yards and it is perfect for me. I could spend much more but do not feel why I would.
customer_reviews.author: MrMike

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: Like this scope, using it for range targeting. The mag range is sufficient for my 50 to 100 yard ranges. I got a reasonable tripod to mount it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A. Franco

customer_reviews.title: a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I had a Barska 20x75 and over 50 power it as so cloudy it was worthless, a waste of money. This Celestron on full power I can see 22 cal. at 100 yds easy. Goes to show you quality will cost you more, but if you can't see the target what good is it. So far this Celestron is OK up to 200 yds. I have not checked it over that.
customer_reviews.author: roy holmes

customer_reviews.title: Too legit to quit
customer_reviews.text: The view of salt lake City from my bedroom 25 miles away
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Spotting Scope
customer_reviews.text: Super clear lens, excellent field of view ... nice, simple controls ... as you would expect from Celestron. Solid value product.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Dawg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. The angled eyepiece is handy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. The angled eyepiece is handy. Magnification and clarity are very good. It is very big. Not a compact model. Larger than average I think, which isn't a problem.
customer_reviews.author: MR P

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Used in Yellowstone to give my an up close look of everything. Worked nice!!
customer_reviews.author: Satellite_no

customer_reviews.title: Great Scope!
customer_reviews.text: I used the scope shooting today and from 50 yards the whole target appeared in the scope. My grandson shot the 300 WSM and I watched the holes appear in the target. I still need to buy a tripod and wish that it had come with one.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great.
customer_reviews.text: I can keep an eye on wildlife a hundred yards away and it's like you're very close. Get a better tripod though. The zoom is OK but you lose a lot of the chromatic integrity and focus. At the widest zoom it's amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Terrier Fan22

customer_reviews.title: Good for 100 to 200 yards, but need a very sturdy/stable tripod
customer_reviews.text: I only use it for 50 to 100 yard range, so I am not too concerned about lack of clarity at max zoom settings. Do buy a good tripod, though.
customer_reviews.author: Sam P.

customer_reviews.title: Great Scope
customer_reviews.text: Great scope for the price. Works well out to 300 yards. Works great at 100 yards. You will need to get a really solid tripod. I am very happy with the Celestron 93610 AstroMaster AZ Tripod for Small telescopes that I also purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond K. Poplar

customer_reviews.title: Great scope, excellent price
customer_reviews.text: The Celestron 52250 is my entry-level scope - I have no other scopes to compare it to - but I am very happy with its performance. It is built solidly, is easy to use, and provides images that meet and exceed all my expectations - and the price can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: very nice quality product and fair pricing too
customer_reviews.text: very nice quality product and fair pricing too. seller shipped it out right away in a neat external box to protect it from damage. This is not a 500.00 scope but for the price is very clear and using a tripod makes it all that much better,
customer_reviews.author: Kodie

customer_reviews.title: A bit of refringence at higher magnifications but just fine in the upper mid-range to wide field of view
customer_reviews.text: A bit of refringence at higher magnifications but just fine in the upper mid-range to wide field of view. Made in China but fills the bill for lake bird identification.
customer_reviews.author: J. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Gave it to my husband for Christmas. He cannot wait to use it while hunting.
customer_reviews.author: tkmom

customer_reviews.title: but absolutely great for 1/10 the price
customer_reviews.text: Not a Swarovski, but absolutely great for 1/10 the price. Very happy so far. Unless U ar a professional writing off the cost, or have $ to burn, this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Bowen

customer_reviews.title: works great at the range
customer_reviews.text: I was getting ready to spend more money one, works great at the range, very clear optics.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy & Steve

product_meta.title: Celestron – Ultima 80 Angled Spotting Scope – 20 to 60x80mm Zoom Eyepiece – Multi-Coated Optics for Bird Watching, Wildlife, Scenery and Hunting – Waterproof and Fogproof – Includes Soft Carrying Case
product_meta.description:
Style:80 - 45°| Configuration:Spotting ScopeThe Celestron Ultima 80 series was designed to perform well in a range of viewing situations. Outdoor enthusiasts and adventurers will love it for observing nature and sharp long-distance spotting. The 80mm refractor features excellent multi-coated optics packed into a portable and durable housing and includes a powerful 20-60x zoom eyepiece. The Ultima spotting scope is completely waterproof and fogproof. It’s been filled with dry nitrogen gas and sealed to prevent internal fogging of the lenses. You’ll be able to enjoy your viewing activities to the fullest even during extreme weather conditions! The Ultima 80 angled spotting scope also includes a T-mount adapter for digiscoping; this allows you to capture bright, sharp images through your spotting scope. Simply attach your DSLR camera equipped with a T-ring, and you’re ready to go! Each Celestron optical product is engineered for the highest performance, durability, and quality in its class. Celestron optics provide you with a lifetime of viewing enjoyment at an unbeatable value! Buy with confidence from the world’s #1 telescope brand and a leading sport optics brand, based in California since 1960. You’ll also receive a Limited Lifetime warranty and unlimited access to technical support from our team of US-based experts.

AMAZON.COM
 

Celestron’s popular Ultima 80mm Zoom Spotting Scope offers images that are noticeably brighter and sharper than entry level 60mm spotters. The Ultima 80 is a refractor style spotting scope with an Achromatic objective lens. Excellent light transmission is assured by multi-layer anti-reflection coatings on the objective lens as well as on the zoom eyepiece and the BAK-4 prisms. The multi-coated 80mm objective lens delivers 77% brighter views than a 60mm scope, and the built in zoom lens produces sharp images from 20X all the way up to 60X magnification. The Ultima 80 features a sleek, waterproof design and includes a padded soft case with zippers on both ends so the scope can be protected even while mounted on a tripod. Including the eyepiece the Ultima 80 measures just over 18 inches long and weighs about 3.6 pounds. The rubber eyecup can be removed to expose a standard “T-thread” for attaching a camera. I like the 45* angled eyepiece because I can use a shorter tripod to support the spotting scope while viewing or while taking pictures with a small camera attached to the eyepiece. 

The focus ranges from 27 feet to the horizon with just a few turns of the focus knob. When I fold down the rubber eye cup I can keep my glasses on and see the whole 2 degree field of view at 20X magnification. With my glasses on I need very little focus adjustment while I crank the zoom eyepiece from 20X up to 60X. Sometimes though I like to take my glasses off while observing because the view seems to have just a little more contrast and sharpness. I like the fact that the Ultima 80 gives me a sharp image either way. 

The drawback of the tradition crown and flint achromatic lens used in the Ultima 80 Zoom Spotting Scope is a bit of false color, also known as blue fringing or chromatic aberration. Blue fringing seems well controlled at 20X magnification, but it becomes increasingly noticeable as I zoom up to 60X. Celestron also offers the Ultima 80ED and the Regal 80 F-ED spotting scopes which use exotic ED glass lenses to virtually eliminate blue fringing and produce the sharpest possible high power views.



Shot at 20X zoom at about 20 yards, cropped 50%
(Click here to see uncropped)

Shot at 20X zoom at about 50 yards, cropped 30%

Shot at 20X zoom, uncropped but reduced in size
(Click here to see at 60X zoom)

Shot at 20X zoom at about 50 yards, cropped 30%


FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Ultima 80mm offers a step up in aperture from the 65mm, offering 50% brighter images. The 80mm refractor features excellent multi-coated optics packed into a portable and durable refractor design and it comes standard with a 20-60x zoom eyepiece. This series was designed to perform well in a range of viewing situations, making it a great all-around optical instrument. Youll love it for observing nature and long distance spotting. The green metal optical tube allows for subtle observation in any nature environment. Ultima spotters are a great companion for any nature or outdoor enthusiast.

See more
feature_bullets: ULTIMA ANGLED SPOTTING SCOPE: The outdoor enthusiast’s choice is our great all-around spotting scope with an 80mm objective lens and a 45° viewing angle. Perfect for observing nature and long-distance viewing.

INCLUDES ESSENTIALS FOR BETTER VIEWING: Celestron Ultima 80 includes an extended tripod mounting plate, a zoom eyepiece with an integrated T-adapter for digiscoping, a carrying case, an eyepiece lens cap, an eyepiece port cover, a soft carrying case, an eyepiece pouch, a lens cloth, and an instruction manual.

MULTI-COATED OPTICS: Every lens surface is coated multiple times with anti-reflective coatings to improve the color and contrast of images and maximize brightness, so you can enjoy brighter and sharper images, even when ambient lighting conditions are dim.

SHARP ZOOM EYEPIECE FUNCTION: Our Ultima 80 Spotting Scope features a large focus dial, allowing you to bring your subject into razor-sharp focus before it moves away. The included zoom eyepiece helps you zero in for detailed views of distant subjects in seconds.

UNBEATABLE WARRANTY AND CUSTOMER SUPPORT: Buy with confidence from the world’s #1 telescope brand, based in California since 1960. You’ll also receive a two-year warranty and unlimited access to technical support from our team of US-based experts.
